titles.title: Gädlä Täklä Haymanot “Vita of Täklä Haymanot” / Mäṣḥafä lǝdätu lä-ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot “Book of the Genealogy of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot” / Täʾamrä Täklä Haymanot “Miracles of Täklä Haymanot”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Täklä Haymanot “Vita of Täklä Haymanot” (fols. 4ra-109va) II) Mäṣḥafä lǝdätu lä-ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot “Book of the Genealogy of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot” (fols. 109va-111va) - Genealogy of Täklä Haymanot (fols. 109va-111va) III) Täʾamrä Täklä Haymanot “Miracles of Täklä Haymanot”: 22 miracles (fols. 111vb-129rb)
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: ʾAbrәham is mentioned as the scribe in supplication formulas (s. fols. 109ra, 111va, 129rb).

donors.donor: The original donor(s) or commissioners may be those indicated in the prologue of the Vita (fol. 4rb): Śahlä Rufaʾel, followed by a name which was erased with the exception of the last letter (b); his mother Wälättä Qal and his father Täsfa Mikaʾel. It seems that in many cases the second word in the rubricated name Śahlä Rufaʾel was later deleted and Śәllase was added instead (usually in black ink), to make Śahlä Śәllase out of it. In the same way, the name Wälättä Qal was transformed into Wälättä Täklä Haymanot. Śahlä Śәllase, Wälättä Śәllase, Wälättä Täklä Haymanot, Wäldä Sәmʿon are mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 29va, 36ra, 43ra, 54rb, 73ra, 93vb, 99va, 106rb, 109ra, 110va and passim. In most of the cases the names are added in a different, somewhat later hand. On fol. 129rb, an addition to the supplication formula indicates that Wälättä Śәllase acquired the book with her own means.

txstates.txstate: Many fols. are damaged by water. Holes skilfully amended on fols. 15, 17, 50, etc.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown leather (for the most part hidden under the secondary textile cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(3; s.l. 1, stub after 1/fols. 1r-3v) – I(10/fols. 4r-13v) – II(8; s.l. 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 14r-21v) – III(10/fols. 22r-31v) – IV(10; s.l. 3, stub after 7; 7, stub after 3/fols. 32r-41v) – V(10; s.l. 3, stub after 6; 7, stub after 2/fols. 42r-51v) – VI(4/fols. 52r-54v) – VII(8; s.l. 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 55r-62v) – VIII(8; s.l. 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 63r-70v) – IX(10; s.l. 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 71r-80v) – X(10; s.l. 3, stub after 7; 7, stub after 3/fols. 81r-90v) – XI(10; s.l. 3, stub after 7; 7, stub after 3/fols. 91r-100v) – XII(10; s.l. 3, stub after 7; 7, stub after 3/fols. 101r-110v) – XIII(8/fols. 111r-118v) – XIV(8/fols. 119r-126) – XV(4/fols. 127r-130v)

taunit.ln-info: cp. different number of lines in fol. 22,
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the protagonist (both Fǝssǝḥa Ṣǝyon and Täklä Haymanot), name of the scribe (fol. 129rb); incipit of Text I and its subsections (fols. 4r, 19vb, 29va, 53rb, 54rb, 98rb, 99va, 106rb, 106vb, 109ra, 109rb); incipit of Text II (fol. 109v); incipit of Text III and its subsections (fols. 111vb, 112rb, 112vb, 113rb, 115rb, 116ra, 116va, 117ra, 118ra, 119rb, 120ra, 120va, 121ra, 121va, 122ra, 122vb, 123va, 124rb, 124vb, 125vb, 126rb, 127rb, 128vb); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. On the incipit pages of Text I and II (fols. 4r, 109v), a few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines).

otherdetails.otherdetail: The text of the Vita represents the first of the two sub-types of the Däbrä Libanos recension of the Gädlä Täklä Haymanot (close, but not identical to the published text of the Vita, s. E.A.W. BUDGE (ed., tr.), The Life and Miracles of Takla Hâymânôt in the Version of Dabra Lîbânôs..., London 1906).

additional.cont: Fol. 130v: Crude recent note in pencil, hardly readable.

extras.extra: - Two thin parallel lines are used for line filling (e.g., fols. 22vb, 27va, 54va etc.) or for filling the space between the words (esp. rubricated, s. fols. 30ra-rb, 43vb, 45va 46ra, 51vb, 52ra, 53rb, 62rb, 66va, 127vb, etc.; cp. also fol. 38v, the bottom). - Immediate corrections are indicated by two thin red lines, above and below the word: e.g., fols. 28ra, 49rb. - Erasures: fols. 7vb, 70rb (with two black and one red lines drawn over it). - The names of the donors are sometimes added interlineally: s. fols. 43r, 73ra, 83vb, 99va, 106rb over a different name, 119ra, 120ra, 120v-121r. - A name is washed out on fol. 53rb. - Corrections or omitted words are written interlineally: e.g., fols. 12ra, 90va, 104ra or in the margins: fols. 89?, 91r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin (mostly encircled with thin black lines), possibly in the main hand: ዘመስከረም: fol. 4r ዘጥቅምት: fol. 15v ዘኅዳር: fol. 23v ዘታኅሣሥ: fol. 29v ዘጥር: fol. 36r ዘየካቲት: fol. 43r ዘመጋቢት: fol. 54r ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 63v; decorated ዘግንቦት: fol. 73r ዘሰኔ: fol. 82v ዘሐምሌ: fol. 93v ዘነሐሴ: fol. 99v.
